column3: Concept ACK
Updated at fbc3c9f as suggested in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16689#discussion_r317160287 (but only output from WalletTxToJSON as we may have small diffs between RPCs for other fields)

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->

No conflicts as of last run.

nit: missing a space after the `:` here.
Matches the description from the `listreceivedbylabel` [help](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/wallet/rpcwallet.cpp#L1243).

I'd rather pull this out into a static const RPCResult in a moveonly commit, since it is used in three places. And then only update that single place with the documentation. We do that in other places (like getmempoolentry)
The coinbase is the input. The output is simply generated.
Doesn't a transaction including a coinbase input qualify as a coinbase one ? We don't enforce this wording strictly if the rest of the codebase I think.
This line should not be deleted.
While extracting this, it wouldn't hurt to fixup the nits that wouldn't be worth a commit on their own, like adding the missing period at the end of this sentence and next sentence.

e.g. s/chain
"/chain.
"/ and s/one
"/one.
"/

Suggestion: s/Only returns true if transaction is a coinbase one./True if the transaction is a coinbase, otherwise false./\n\nThough https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16689#discussion_r317281171 should be handled first.
It would be nice to align the horizontal spacing of this entire section.
Grammar fix: s/List of txid with which this transaction is conflicting./List of txids that conflict with this transaction./
Other half of https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16689#discussion_r317326379. This line should be moved to before TransactionDescriptionString() -- it's in the wrong place.
"Only returned" means what? Maybe it's just me, but this and the rest of the sentence isn't clear.\n\nnit: missing period at end of sentence.
Same here as for the identical line above https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16689#discussion_r317329490.
nit: It looks like you added a tab at the start of this line.
nit: It looks like you've added a tab at the start of this line.
nit: another tab.
s/'true'/True/\n\nPossibly: s/Only available for/Only applies to/
Agree.
nit, try to have it aligned with surrounding lines.
Good catch, could mention that it is only present if not empty.
@ariard Could you follow up here?
Sorry for delay, pushed correction
You mean `blockhash` compare to `trusted` and others ? Don't get the misalignment here

I think the first commit (moveonly) should actually be moveonly (via `git diff --color-moved=dimmed-zebra`).\n\nOtherwise the rendered whitespace will be messed up. (You can get the help text with the `help listtransactions` rpc)
It returns array here. So `\"walletconflicts\": [ \"TXID\", ... ]` should be used instead. See #16869 as an example.
This is wrong. The field can never be `false`

I think this would be better describing (based on #16869):
```
            "    "walletconflicts":[      (array) Conflicting transaction ids (double spends).
"
            "        "TXID",              (string) The transaction id.
"
```

Could you update this to be `(bool, optional)` and address [this comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16951#discussion_r327494296):\n\n> if this is optional, I think the help text should also mention when the value is present or not.
Rewrote comment but not sure about optional, it seems to be reserved when a optional feature is involved like HD-wallet, which is not the case with IsTrusted
Why is this removed?
I'd say to remove midnight, because we don't use that nomenclature anywhere else
I liked the previous wording, which was more accurate.\n\n`.. means the transaction conflicted that many blocks ago.`
Corrected
